name: ZUZABED & Breakfast B&B, Apartments and Villas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would definitely advice this place, as we had a amazing time there, and Luis, the owner, was making everything to have us very confortable. It is located in a street with no car (necessary to have good knees though), closed by to everything (sites, restaurants, bars, views of the city etc.). The bathroom is cleaned everyday and breakfast served in a nice room. I will 100% go back there if I stay (hopefully) again any time soon in Lisabon!! You should really go there!
reviews.title: Excellent location, very clean, nice rooms and friendly Luis!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I arranged to stay at the Zuzabed City Break Apartment with my parents and an aunt (ie 4 adults) and we were extremely well received. I will try to summarize the reason why I strongly recommend the Zuzabed.
reviews.title: Very personal, excelent service, location and experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Late arrival: we arrived on a very late flight and we were received by Carlos with a big smile who helped us settle into the flat. He gave us a mobile to contact him the following day and meet us for a coffee and explaining lots of things about Lisbon.
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Apartment: Location is excelent, very close to the Bairro Alto and Chiado (walking distance however taxis were so cheap that my parents preferred leaving the exercise to the gym only), flat fitted 4 adults very comfortably, it is very clean and modern, has all the kitchen appliances you need. When we arrived the fridge was filled with breakfast items (yogurt, cheese, ham, butter, milk, coffee, tea, etc etc) and fresh bread is delivered to your door every morning. Some reviews say that the flat is on a ladder. It is. However it is not bad at all. 2 minutes down and you are in a road full of taxis and transport.
reviews.title: a bit special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Service: Carlos met us the next morning and explained all about Lisbon. He spent a couple of hours talking about what to do, where to eat, where and what to shop. All with a massive smile on his face. He took us to get to know the guest house and the bed & breakfast and Luiz ,who I have been in touch during the bookings. A daily call to check how we were was so nice and they helped us sorting out airport transfer with Nuno (who deserve a mention himself). They were flexible with our timing and they were just amazing.
reviews.title: Little Piece of Travel Heaven! The comforts of home in Lisbon, Portugal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: Brilliant little guest house, staff are brilliant. Very clean, stayed in a lovely room. Shared bathroom isn't as bad as it sounds, and is well equipt and clean. Breakfast is modest, but is enough to start the day.
reviews.title: The only place I would consider in Lisbon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luis is a very good host, and made a great recommendation for a Portuguese dinner.
reviews.title: Excellent in all ways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay again if I make it back to Lisbon.
reviews.title: Great place in Lisbon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Most of the reviews have stated all the key points - the welcome, the mobile phone, the advice, the great breakfast, the great interactions with all the staff, the location etc. All are true. Zuzabed is located in Calcada do Doque - this is a pedestrianised street - well more a walkway with steep steps. There are a number of restaurants immediately on this street. Getting you luggage into or out of Zuzabed is the only problem - after navigating down do Doque there are 2 sets of stairs leading to the B&B entrance and then you might have another set of narrow and steep stairs to your room. If you have a lot of luggage this can be a problem. Having said that, I would still strongly recommend staying here - we had a terrace room where we shared the balcony and could look out over Lisbon or down at the diners in the street below. The location is fantastic - a short walk down to Rossio rail station or Rossio Square or a short walk up into Chiado with all the restaurants, bars etc. Too many to choose from. Thanks to Carlos, Anna, Christina and Luis for all the advice and help esp Carlos - the taxi driver turned up on time as you had booked for us and helped us with our cases - we made the flight - Many thanks
reviews.title: Good B&B in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Zuzabeb B&B for five nights recently. It is situated conveniently in the old city,close to many restaurants, attractions and the railway station. Luis and his staff Ana, Carlos and Christina were very friendly and extremely helpful, providing us daily with excellent recommendations and local knowledge. They even provided us with a mobile phone on which we could contact them at any time.Rooms were clean and breakfast each day was fresh and healthy with plenty of choice. The two steep flights of stairs provided good daily exercise.
reviews.title: CHIADO STUDIO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to Lisbon in October of '11. After driving around lost in Lisbon for 3 hours (easy to do there) Luis' partner waited for us at the apartment the entire time. We felt terrible but when we finally arrived, he greeted us as if we were long lost family and even helped us park the car. He showed us the apartment and the neighborhood and gave us suggestions of how to enjoy the city as the locals do. We loved the fresh Portugese bread waiting at our door every morning. They even gave us a cell phone to use ! They are experts at making their guests feel welcomed and taken care of. We will be back !
reviews.title: Like Having Family in Portugal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Planning a trip with three generations of ten family members ranging in ages from10 years to 74 years is a challenge. But Zuzabed had three apartments that suited everyone's needs. Close to Restaurants,buses, And within walking distance of Rossio Square, it was the perfect spot to allow grandpa his afternoon rest while the more energetic explored shops for souvenir shopping and the ladies love it.i The dads also liked to rest in the afternoons sitting on the sunny apartment porches sampling various Portugese ports (the drinking kind) while writing their blogs and comparing their many photos. The location was perfect, Carlos our host made us feel right at home and provided us a cell phone in case we required any assistance anytime. I would go back there in a minute.
reviews.title: Zuzabed suite on Imprensa Nacionale suited our family of ten!,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hmcj
reviews.title: A rare gem in Central Lisbon's beautiful historic centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, it has been quite a while since we stayed at this lovely little B&B, but I can honestly say it was a perfect little spot for our romantic break that we had planned.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE IN A GREAT LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: it is good to see that the reviews are still saying very positive things about Zuzabed, it is a really rare find.
reviews.title: The best place for everyone in Lisbon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luis provided maps to find the property and it helped knowing what the doorway looked like prior to finding it (photo on TA, Ree-Travels, Aug 2011 - thank you). The taxi from the airport cost about ten Euro’s. The front entrance is not inspiring – peeling paintwork and a selection of bins did not inspire confidence, but be patient. Narrow stairs take to up two floors to Zuzubed and welcome you to a world of the small but perfectly formed. We stayed in the Garden Room which is next to the communal lounge/breakfast room, this meant we could chill in the lounge without locking up and going down stairs – and we were the only ones to use this room outside of the breakfast time (the other rooms are on a different floor and have roof terraces).
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t need to use the free mobile phone they provided, but it was a nice reassuring insurance policy which probably made our excursions a bit more daring.
reviews.title: Wonderful central B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are looking for a central B&B, with a hearty breakfast and built in tour guides to answer all you questions – look no further.
reviews.title: Fantastic and an Owner who makes you feel welcome as soon as you arrive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be aware that being Londoners, we are used to the city sounds at night and because the location is super central, it is not quiet on the street outside at night – folk walk past chatting away all hours of the night and the bin men can make a hell of a racket bouncing the bins up and down the steps. We sleep with the windows open – if you like to close the double glazed doors and shove on the air-conditioning it will be considerably quieter.
reviews.title: Some pluses, some minuses.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For silence at night go stay near the Castle. This area is deadly silent after dark, but not so well located for the nightlife and sightseeing.
reviews.title: Top choice

aka: Zuzabed & Breakfast b&b, Suites And Apartments Hotel
description: If you're looking for a genuine and welcoming Portuguese way of living don't look any furhter.At Zuza we proudly love show our city and help you to make you feel at home is indeed our goal. Anyway, this is not an hotel, ok! :) This is a B&B for relaxed people that consider comfort and prime location together with a local home service and company the most important thing to have when on holidays. While here you'll find the rest of the small luxuries we have for you.
